modName: jBS2BG - BodySlide to BodyGen Converter and Generator
summary:
This is a tool that helps create templates and morphs INI for RaceMenu's BodyGen.
BodyGen is a feature in RaceMenu that can assign different body types or shapes to each NPCs in the game.
descriptionHtml:
[b]Requires [url=https://java.com/en/download/]Java 8[/url] installed.[/b]

[color=#ffff00][size=4]If you don't know how to use BodyGen, check out the bottom of the description for a guide.[/size][/color]

[b][size=4]As of [color=#00ff00]v1.1.0[/color], inverted sliders are calculated differently, so instead of zeroing all sliders, a new neutral preset is required for building the base body, armors and clothing.
See the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88707?tab=files]Main Files[/url] section for the required presets for building your base bodies and outfits.
[/size][/b][size=4][b]For CBBE SE Body, see [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88707?tab=files]Optional Files[/url] section for the settings.json file.[/b][/size]

[color=#e06666][b]Requirements:[/b][/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]
[/url][list]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?][/url][*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?][/url][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49015/?]BodySlide[/url]﻿ - For creating XML presets.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]RaceMenu[/url]﻿ - BodyGen.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit[/url]﻿ - Optional, for retrieving a list of NPCs from different mods/masters.
[/list]

[b][color=#e06666]Description:[/color][/b]
This is a GUI program for generating RaceMenu BodyGen INIs from BodySlide XML presets. With this, you could just add your BodySlide presets and target NPCs through the user interface and generate the [color=#e69138]"templates.ini"[/color] and [color=#e69138]"morphs.ini"[/color] required for BodyGen instead of writing the INIs manually.
BodyGen is a feature in RaceMenu for assigning different body morphs to every NPC in the game.

[b][color=#e06666]Important Note:[/color][/b]
Once a character is morphed in-game, reassigning a different preset to it by changing the [color=#ff7700]"[/color][color=#e69138]morphs.ini"[/color] will not work.
To solve this, you can either clear your save's skse co-save file where the morphs are stored or MAYBE delete it(PROBABLY DANGEROUS, not sure).
You can search for NetImmerse Override Cleaner for the cleaning tool.

[b][color=#e06666]Fallout 4 Support:[/color][/b]
I've been informed that it works with Fallout 4's [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/12631/?]LooksMenu[/url] BodyGen.
Just modify the [color=#e69138]"settings.json"[/color] so that it looks like this:
[code]{
  "Defaults": {
  },
  "Multipliers": {
  },
  "Inverted": [
  ]
}
[/code]


[b][color=#e06666]Features:[/color][/b]
[list]
[*]Generate templates and morphs INI.
[*]Save and load your settings to and from a .jbs2bg file (json file) that can be shared to anyone since the data of the presets are stored in the file so the external XML and text files that were used are no longer required. 
[*]"Edit SetSliders" allows you to set the weight or even set the range to which a SetSlider will randomize.
[*]Table views for NPCs are sortable and filterable for easier management.
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40280]BodyTypes of Skyrim[/url]﻿ JSON conversion.
[/list]

[b][color=#93c47d]Guide:[/color][/b]
For this guide, I'll be using CBBE body as that is what I mainly use.
Also, this guide will be assuming that you already have both BodySlide and RaceMenu installed and that you know how to use BodySlide.
[spoiler][b][color=#6fa8dc]1. Preparing the tool[/color][/b]
Download jBS2BG and extract archive to any location.
Optionally, download the images archive, these images can be useful for assigning morphs to NPCs, so that you know who's who.
Of course, NPCs that don't have images won't show up in the Image View.
Extract the images archive to the same folder as [color=#e69138]jBS2BG.jar[/color], it should look like this:
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/pz4qb3bdr/directory.png[/img]

[b][color=#6fa8dc]2. Setting up base body[/color][/b]
BodyGen needs a base body with morphs enabled to function.
Using BodySlide, set the preset to [color=#ffd966]-Zeroed CBBE-[/color] and generate your base body with [color=#6d9eeb]"Build Morphs"[/color] enabled.
Generated files should go inside [color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\actors\character\character assets"[/color].
The folder should now contain the following files: [color=#e69138]"femalebody_0.nif"[/color], [color=#e69138]"femalebody_1.nif"[/color] and [color=#e69138]"femalebody.tri"[/color].
Your [color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\actors\character\character assets"[/color] folder should look like this:
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/u89gd8c27/basebody_directory.png[/img]

[b][color=#6fa8dc]3. Setting up replacer clothes and armors[/color][/b]
For BodyGen morphs to be visible on clothed characters, you need outfits with RaceMenu Morphs.
You can find several outfit mods with morphs support across the net, here are some:
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65831/?]Vanilla Outfits BodySlided[/url] (includes armors and town clothes)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49286/?]OCR - Omnisway Clothing Replacer - CBBE BodySlide BBP TBBP[/url] (includes fine clothes, jarl clothes, wedding dress...)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/66144/?]The Provocateur's Armoury[/url] (includes mage robes, monk robes, necromancer robes...)

Build these outfits with the same slider settings as the base body, in this case, use [color=#ffd966]-Zeroed CBBE-[/color] preset.
You also need to build these outfits with [color=#6d9eeb]"Build Morphs"[/color] enabled. You'll know you have morphs enabled if you get a [color=#e69138]"*.tri"[/color] file next to the output [color=#e69138]"*.nifs"[/color].
There are instructions on those pages on how to build them. Please read and follow them carefully if you have no idea what you're doing.

The files you've built should be used as replacers, for example, your [color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\clothes\farmclothes01"[/color] folder should look something like this:
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/w02f86l5b/farmclothes_directory.png[/img]

Those .nif files are the meshes built from BodySlide, including the .tri file, which contains the morph data for RaceMenu.

[b][color=#6fa8dc]4. Enabling BodyGen[/color][/b]
With RaceMenu installed, go to [color=#e69138]"Data\SKSE\Plugins"[/color] folder, open the file [color=#e69138]"nioverride.ini"[/color] and ensure that
BodyGen is enabled, [color=#ffd966]bEnableBodyGen=1[/color], like this:
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/mfisl9dsv/b_Enable_Body_Gen.png[/img]
This will enable BodyGen in the game.

[b][color=#6fa8dc]5. Using jBS2BG to convert BodySlide XMLs to BodyGen templates[/color][/b]
Using the tool is pretty straight-forward.
Make an XML preset in BodySlide of the body type you like and use [color=#6d9eeb]"Save As..."[/color] to save it somewhere as XML.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/htmocxff3/bodyslide_saveas.png[/img]

Launch [color=#e69138]jBS2BG.jar[/color], then click [color=#6d9eeb]"Add BodySlide XML Presets"[/color] button then locate and add the XML that you just saved from BodySlide.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/nukd9yzgf/add_preset.png[/img]

After adding, you can now see the BodyGen equivalent of the XML preset that you created.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/ivwuvig8v/preset_added.png[/img]

By default, the resulting template will use the Big values, meaning, the max weight of the body you created.
This can be changed by using the [color=#6d9eeb]"Edit SetSliders"[/color] button. With it, you can pick the weight to use or even use range between Small(Min) and Big(Max).

[b][color=#6fa8dc]6. Using jBS2BG to assign presets to custom targets like "All Female NPCs", "All Female Nords"... etc[/color][/b]
Now that you have a preset in your list, you now have to assign it to some NPCs.
Now then, go to the morphs tab:
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/aqesxcka7/morphs_tab.png[/img]

Say you want to assign your preset to all female NPCs in the game.
In the Custom Target text field, type in [color=#e69138]"All|Female"[/color] (without the quotes), then click the [color=#6d9eeb]"Add"[/color] button just below the text field.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/g1tpi0gmn/add_preset_to_target.png[/img]

When you have some presets in the list, a random preset will be automatically assigned to a newly added target.
Assigning more presets to the [color=#e69138]"All|Female"[/color] target will make BodyGen pick a random one from the assigned presets to morph the target.

For assigning morphs to specific races, you could use something like [color=#e69138]"All|Female|NordRace"[/color], [color=#e69138]"All|Female|BretonRace"[/color], etc...

[b][color=#6fa8dc]7. Using jBS2BG to assign presets to NPCs[/color][/b]
Now, say, you want to assign a preset to a specific NPC,
First, you need a text file containing a list of NPCs to be added. You can generate this using the included TES5Edit script in the jBS2BG folder: [color=#e69138]"jBS2BG Export NPC List.pas"[/color].
If you don't have TES5Edit, at the moment, you can just use the one included in the jBS2BG folder: [color=#e69138]"FemaleNPCList - Dawnguard + Dragonborn + HearthFires + Skyrim.txt"[/color].

To generate a list from TES5Edit, copy the .pas script into your [color=#e69138]"Edit Scripts"[/color] folder.
Right-click the Master/Mod that you want to get the NPCs from (You can select multiple Masters), then click [color=#6d9eeb]"Apply Script"[/color].
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/64iooygqn/apply_script.png[/img]

Then select the script [color=#e69138]"jBS2BG Export NPC List"[/color], then hit [color=#6d9eeb]"OK"[/color].
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/d7qk4lh1b/apply_script2.png[/img]

Wait for the export process to finish, this process might take a while for Masters with tons of NPCs in them.
After it's done exporting, you can find the [color=#e69138]"*.txt"[/color] file in the same folder as [color=#e69138]"TES5Edit.exe"[/color] or your Skyrim installation folder.

With the text file exported, go back to jBS2BG, now click [color=#6d9eeb]"Add NPCs"[/color], then [color=#6d9eeb]"Add NPCs from File"[/color], locate and select the text file containing the list.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/y4ms97hm7/add_npcs_from_file.png[/img]

Now you can browse the table and select an NPC you want to add. To add one to the list, select the NPC then click [color=#6d9eeb]"<= Add"[/color].
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/3zybnxcjz/npc_added.png[/img]

You can click on the table headers to sort the list and you can also right click on the headers to filter the list.

[b][color=#6fa8dc]8. Generating and exporting the INIs[/color][/b]
You can simply click on the [color=#6d9eeb]"Generate Templates"[/color] and [color=#6d9eeb]"Generate Morphs"[/color] buttons to generate the content needed for [color=#e69138]"templates.ini"[/color] and [color=#e69138]"morphs.ini"[/color]
which you can copy and paste to the respective INIs.

But an easier way is to go to [color=#6d9eeb]File -> Export BodyGen INIs[/color].
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/tiqo0x8yn/export.png[/img]

After that, both [color=#e69138]"templates.ini"[/color] and [color=#e69138]"morphs.ini"[/color] will be exported to your chosen location.
[img]https://s17.postimg.cc/nukda0hgv/exported.png[/img]



Now, put both [color=#e69138]"templates.ini"[/color] and [color=#e69138]"morphs.ini"[/color] inside the folder [color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\actors\character\BodyGenData\%MOD_FILENAME_WITH_EXT%\"[/color].
Where %MOD_FILENAME_WITH_EXT% is something like [color=#e69138]"Skyrim.esm"[/color], let's just use [color=#e69138]"Skyrim.esm"[/color] for example,
[color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\actors\character\BodyGenData\Skyrim.esm\"[/color].

Finally, you should have:
[color=#e69138]"Data\meshes\actors\character\BodyGenData\Skyrim.esm\templates.ini"
"Data\meshes\actors\character\BodyGenData\Skyrim.esm\morphs.ini"[/color]

And... that's it! Fire up the game and enjoy!
[/spoiler]
author: asdasfa

files.name: jBS2BG
files.changelogHtml:
Changed the font of all lists, tables and text areas to Consolas.
Just to be consistent.

files.name: jBS2BG src
files.changelogHtml:
Changed the font of all lists, tables and text areas to Consolas.
Just to be consistent.

files.name: jBS2BG
files.changelogHtml:
Enforced UTF-8 encoding in writing and reading to and from files. This means non-English characters(Japanese, Chinese...) can now be displayed correctly.
Note: Before importing a list of NPCs that contains non-English characters, make sure the text file is UTF-8 encoded, save it as UTF-8 if it is not.
Now utilizes Commons IO for file reading and writing.
Better trimming of FormIDs.
Now sorts NPCs by Master's name on generate morphs/export.
Now displays an error message if settings.json has invalid content or is erroneous.

files.name: jBS2BG src
files.changelogHtml:
Enforced UTF-8 encoding in writing and reading to and from files. This means non-English characters(Japanese, Chinese...) can now be displayed correctly.
Note: Before importing a list of NPCs that contains non-English characters, make sure the text file is UTF-8 encoded, save it as UTF-8 if it is not.
Now utilizes Commons IO for file reading and writing.
Better trimming of FormIDs.
Now sorts NPCs by Master's name on generate morphs/export.
Now displays an error message if settings.json has invalid content or is erroneous.

files.name: jBS2BG
files.changelogHtml:
Now uses juniversalchardet to try to detect the encoding of a file(e.g. Shift-JIS) before parsing/reading. It's not guaranteed to handle all types of encoding, so saving files as UTF-8 is still recommended.
Added more error messages.
Minor change to FormID trimming.

files.name: jBS2BG src
files.changelogHtml:
Now uses juniversalchardet to try to detect the encoding of a file(e.g. Shift-JIS) before parsing/reading. It's not guaranteed to handle all types of encoding, so saving files as UTF-8 is still recommended.
Added more error messages.
Minor change to FormID trimming.

files.name: jBS2BG
files.changelogHtml:
Added a table column for displaying assigned presets. This means NPCs can now be filtered/sorted by their assigned presets.
Added a toggle for assigning a random preset when adding an NPC(Assign Random).
Added button for randomly assigning presets to all NPCs with none assigned(Fill Empty).
Added button for clearing assigned presets of all NPCs(Clear Assignments).
Changed notification's modality to Application.
More slider preset name checks, replace all "."s in a name with space.

files.name: jBS2BG src
files.changelogHtml:
Added a table column for displaying assigned presets. This means NPCs can now be filtered/sorted by their assigned presets.
Added a toggle for assigning a random preset when adding an NPC(Assign Random).
Added button for randomly assigning presets to all NPCs with none assigned(Fill Empty).
Added button for clearing assigned presets of all NPCs(Clear Assignments).
Changed notification's modality to Application.
More slider preset name checks, replace all "."s in a name with space.

files.name: jBS2BG
files.changelogHtml:
Changed calculation for inverted sliders, should result in a more accurate conversion for both CBBE and UUNP. A new base body is required.
BodyTypes of Skyrim JSON conversion support.
Separate UUNP settings file, tick UUNP checkbox to mark a preset as a UUNP preset. This means you can have both CBBE and UUNP morphs in-game.
Enable/Disable sliders from "Edit SetSliders".
Selective Fill Empty.
Defaults are now applied dynamically instead of baking it into the imported preset on import. Presets needs to be re-imported to be covered by this.
File Chooser preferences are now separated by jar location.
File Chooser title bar name for saving fixed.
Moved the Templates and Morphs generation to a separate thread to prevent unresponsiveness when processing large quantities of entries.
Clear generated templates and morphs text area every time a change occurs.
"Edit SetSliders" buttons' text colors makes more sense.
